title: How to change the DLL name in the already compiled application?
content:
I am trying to change the name of the DLL file I had specified for my application before compiling it. When I change the DLL file name I get the error message like: 

System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'MyDLLName'

Is there any way to change the DLL I had specified through .NET Reflector + Reflexil add-in?

comments.text: Okay, I'll ask the blatantly obvious. Why not simply recompile?
@Jongware Because I have lost the source code! Please don't ask me to rewrite the program!!!
@FreeMind The next time, consider using source control and some code hosting.
Well, you seem to think that Reflexil might do it. Have you tried it? How did it fail?
@svick I just do not know how to change the name of the imported DLL file in Reflexil.

answers_data.content:
Due to the fact that there was no answer to the question posed for so long, I decided to add it:

use

reflector and

reflexil, active fork

to change this
